ai-pv34:1.1_0: “One who has lost her duty, Kāsi clothes,
ai-pv34:1.3_0: and your color is on your face.
ai-pv34:2.2_0: those who prevent them from afar.
ai-pv34:2.4_0: and if they do not attend on him;
ai-pv34:3.1_0: With great power, you’re a mighty flood,
ai-pv34:3.2_0: like a hair-tip with an arrow.
ai-pv34:3.4_0: your flesh used to eat it,
ai-pv34:4.3_0: What is a result for deeds?
ai-pv34:5.2_0: while living looking after her life,
ai-pv34:6.2_0: at the time when the time is announced,
ai-pv34:6.4_0: to follow what’s against the good.
ai-pv34:8.1_0: you have seen your sweetness, and practises
ai-pv34:8.3_0: Don’t oppress the sage in his speech,
ai-pv34:8.4_0: Don’t let the simile of the back.”
ai-pv34:9.1_0: The ninth section for recitation on the story of the Kūṭadanta
